column4: anyone know why a wlan nic cant be seen in the network settings even if ndiswrapper loaded it up just fine?
perhaps you still have to sudo modprobe ndiswrapper
if that solves it, add a single line 'ndiswrapper' to your /etc/modules
just tried that....didnt work....a iwconfig shows both my wlan nics being there...but only one of em can be accessed in the network settings and gtkwifi
are both nics ndiswrapped?
yep..
not sure if ndiswrapper handles that.
I take it you see "hardware present, driver present" for both cards on 'ndiswrapper -i'?
yep....theyre both there
have you stfw for running two wlan cards with ndiswrapper?
sorry. "Search The Fine Web"
according to the ndiswrapper page and wiki, it should work...it even has a parameter of sorts to allow for the naming of multiple wifi nics
yes, my own web search here confirms that too. Sorry, no further ideas here.
thanks anywaymate :)
oh, there's one more idea: does the nonworking one start working when you remove the other?
...lemme check....i will fall off the net though...(im connected using the working card right now)...but ill be back in a sec
did you physically remove the working interface, rmmod ndiswrapper, and start afresh?
i just removed the nic and did a sudo ndiswrapper -e
Well, if you assume that there is an adverse interaction between the drivers or the cards themselves, you would have to go as far back as possible to disprove it.
ok...ill try that....be back in a sec
in fact, I would reboot without the working nic.
will do....brb
back ....what happened was that it didnt work...but as soon as i plugged in the working nic, i got connected
